DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to determine the effect of OrthoPulse™, an intra-oral LED (Light Emitting Diode) photobiomodulation device, on orthodontic treatment time. This is a double-blinded RCT with half the patients receiving treatment from a sham non-functional device, serving as controls, and the other half receiving light therapy treatment from a functional OrthoPulse™. Orthodontic treatment time for the sham-control patients are compared to that of the OrthoPulse™ patients.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Intra-Oral Photobiomodulation on Orthodontic Treatment Time
DOC.criteria: Presence of permanent dentition Eligible and scheduled for full mouth fixed orthodontic treatment. Class I or Class II malocclusion (no more than ½ cusp in Class II) Nonextraction in all quadrants Nonsmoker, nonuse of chewing tobacco Good oral hygiene No adjunct treatment such as extra or intraoral appliances Age 1240 Pregnant females Patient is currently enrolled in another clinical study Nonsteroidal AntiInflammatory drug (NSAID) use during study (Acetominophen acceptable) Periodontally involved teeth Use of bisphosphonates Unerupted erupted teeth Teeth blocked out of alignment and unable to engage initial arch wire
